intro: Rhexia dasystaminea, commonly known as the showy rhexia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland areas. Rhexia dasystaminea is often found in the understory of forests, where it thrives in partial shade.
